result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes: DE to comply with all conditions as listed on the Agreement for Deferred Acceptance of Plea.

records.addlTxt: 1:52 PM Defendant Marla M Carley appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg appeared by video for Marla M Carley.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Per the State they have not received the proof of AODA completion as of yet.  State will request a hearing if documents are not received, no further hearings requested at this time.  Adj 1:56pm
Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

8:08 AM Defendant Marla M Carley in court.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Marla M Carley.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached in this matter.  DE will enter into a DAGP for a 1 year period.  Court recites agreement into the court record.  DE is to abide by all conditions on the DAGP, bond contiues, if DE is successful with all conditions as required charge will be dismissed. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court  notes plea of NC, will hold in abeyance for a one year period. Court will make DAGP an order of the court.  Set for September 6, 2022 @ 1:00 pm, RH. If verification of appointments are made and proof provided to the State this hearing will not be needed. Adj 8:20PM.  

Employment exemption as to alcohol will be allowed as DE is employed at the Casino.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 08:00 am.

03:47 PM Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are working on an agreement.  Court finds good cause to go beyond the TL for PH. Set for June 20, 2022 @8:00AM.   Adj 3:48PM.
Defendant's Motion and Brief to Dismiss Based on the Insufficiency of the Complaint
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  No discussion of the case with W.R.

Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
